what: Set a configuration with a temporary project directory — cfg_tmp_project
title: Set a configuration with a temporary project directory — cfg_tmp_project
text: Set configuration temporary project directory

title: Set a configuration with a temporary project directory — cfg_tmp_project
code: cfg_tmp_project(   xml_path = system.file("sic_project_test1.xml", package = "rsic2"),   cfg = loadConfig(xml_path = xml_path) )

title: Set a configuration with a temporary project directory — cfg_tmp_project
text: xml_path character, path XML SIC project file cfg config, configuration modify

title: Set a configuration with a temporary project directory — cfg_tmp_project
text: updated configuration temporary project directory

title: Set a configuration with a temporary project directory — cfg_tmp_project
code: if (FALSE) { cfg <- cfg_tmp_project() cfg$project$xml_path }

what: Export a section in importation SIC format — create_section_txt
title: Export a section in importation SIC format — create_section_txt
text: Export section importation SIC format

title: Export a section in importation SIC format — create_section_txt
code: create_section_txt(   section_name,   abscissa,   section_type,   profile,   distance_majeur = FALSE )

title: Export a section in importation SIC format — create_section_txt
text: section_name character, name section abscissa numeric, abscissa section reach section_type 1-length character, type section: "T" Trapezoidal, "" Abscissa/Elevation, "L" Width/Elevation profile list matrix, profile section (See details) distance_majeur logical numeric, FALSE minor bed section

title: Export a section in importation SIC format — create_section_txt
text: character, section description SIC text import format.

title: Export a section in importation SIC format — create_section_txt
code: # Trapezoidal section create_section_txt("Trapeze", 0, "T", list(B = 2, S = 1.5, ZF = 100, ZB = 102)) #> [1] "Trapeze $ 0 $  $ 0 $ T" "0"                      "2\t1.5"                  #> [4] "102\t100"                #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "SectionTxt" "character"

what: Generate text export geometry for an uniform reach — create_uniform_reach_txt
title: Generate text export geometry for an uniform reach — create_uniform_reach_txt
text: Generate text export geometry uniform reach

title: Generate text export geometry for an uniform reach — create_uniform_reach_txt
code: create_uniform_reach_txt(   abscissas,   upstream_bed_elevation,   slope,   section_type,   profile,   section_names = paste0("Section x=", abscissas) )

title: Generate text export geometry for an uniform reach — create_uniform_reach_txt
text: abscissas numeric vector section abscissas upstream_bed_elevation numeric, upstream bed elevation (m) slope numeric, bed slope reach (m/m) section_type 1-length character, type section: "T" Trapezoidal, "" Abscissa/Elevation, "L" Width/Elevation profile list matrix, profile section (See details) section_names character vector section names

title: Generate text export geometry for an uniform reach — create_uniform_reach_txt
text: list item section exported create_section_txt. Names list abscissas trailing zeros character sorting.

title: Generate text export geometry for an uniform reach — create_uniform_reach_txt
code: # Trapezoidal section profT <- list(B = 2,S = 1, ZF = 100, ZB = 100 + 2)  # Generate a reach with 2 sections at x=1000 and 2000 create_uniform_reach_txt(abscissas = c(1000, 2000),                          upstream_bed_elevation = 100,                          slope = 0.001,                          section_type = "T",                          profile = profT) #> $`00001000` #> [1] "Section x=1000 $ 1000 $  $ 0 $ T" "0"                                #> [3] "2\t1"                              "102\t100"                          #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "SectionTxt" "character"  #>  #> $`00002000` #> [1] "Section x=2000 $ 2000 $  $ 0 $ T" "0"                                #> [3] "2\t1"                              "101\t99"                           #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "SectionTxt" "character"  #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "ReachTxt" "list"

what: Create SIC geometry sections from a DEM — dem_to_reach_txt
title: Create SIC geometry sections from a DEM — dem_to_reach_txt
text: coordinate system dem metric orthonormal coordinate system.

title: Create SIC geometry sections from a DEM — dem_to_reach_txt
code: dem_to_reach_txt(   dem,   node_coords,   space_step,   section_width,   nb_points = 50,   start = 0,   major_bed = FALSE )  dem_to_reach(dem, node_coords, section_centers, section_width, nb_points = 50)

title: Create SIC geometry sections from a DEM — dem_to_reach_txt
text: dem terra::SpatRaster object altitude data (m). node_coords 2x2 matrix coordinates starting ending points line browse space_step 1-length numeric, distance section (m) section_width 1-length numeric, width sections create nb_points 1-length numeric, number points describe cross-section geometries start 1-length numeric, starting value chainage (.e. section abscissa) along reach major_bed logical, TRUE major bed, FALSE minor-medium bed section_centers See return value get_section_centers

title: Create SIC geometry sections from a DEM — dem_to_reach_txt
text: ReachTxt object list SectionTxt objects (see create_section_txt).

title: Create SIC geometry sections from a DEM — dem_to_reach_txt

what: Create a section cross profile from a DEM — dem_to_section
title: Create a section cross profile from a DEM — dem_to_section
text: Create section cross profile DEM

title: Create a section cross profile from a DEM — dem_to_section
code: dem_to_section(dem, node_coords, section_center, section_width, nb_points = 50)

title: Create a section cross profile from a DEM — dem_to_section
text: dem terra::SpatRaster object altitude data (m). node_coords 2x2 matrix coordinates starting ending points line browse section_center 2-lenght numeric, coordinates section center section_width 1-length numeric, width sections create nb_points 1-length numeric, number points describe cross-section geometries

title: Create a section cross profile from a DEM — dem_to_section
text: matrix coordinates x-z points cross-profile section referential

title: Create a section cross profile from a DEM — dem_to_section

what: Select portion of a reach between two chainages — extract_reach
title: Select portion of a reach between two chainages — extract_reach
text: function used split_reach selecting sections reach.

title: Select portion of a reach between two chainages — extract_reach
code: extract_reach(reach, x_limits)

title: Select portion of a reach between two chainages — extract_reach
text: reach ReachTxt object x_limits 2-length numeric, min max chainage

title: Select portion of a reach between two chainages — extract_reach
text: ReachTxt object containing selected sections.

title: Select portion of a reach between two chainages — extract_reach
code: # Create a 10km long trapezoidal uniform reach profT <- list(   B = 2,   S = (6 - 2) / 2 / 2,   ZF = 100,   ZB = 100 + 2 ) min_reach <- create_uniform_reach_txt(abscissas = seq(0, 10000, 100),                                       upstream_bed_elevation = 10 + 2000 * 0.002,                                       slope = 0.002,                                       section_type = "T",                                       profile = profT) # Extract sections between chainage 2000 m and 4000 m sel_reach <- extract_reach(min_reach, c(2000, 4000))

title: file.path for Windows — file.pathwin
text: behavior file.path remove duplicated slashes use backslashes path separator.

title: file.path for Windows — file.pathwin
code: file.pathwin(...)

title: file.path for Windows — file.pathwin
text: ... Arguments sent file.path

what: Default DEM from the floodam-ead package — floodam_ead_dem
title: Default DEM from the floodam-ead package — floodam_ead_dem
text: default DEM generated floodam.ead::generate_DEM function default arguments.

title: Default DEM from the floodam-ead package — floodam_ead_dem
code: floodam_ead_dem

title: Default DEM from the floodam-ead package — floodam_ead_dem
text: PackedSpatRaster object, use 'terra::rast()' unpack .

title: Default DEM from the floodam-ead package — floodam_ead_dem
text: https://gitlab.irstea.fr/flood-appraisal/floodam/floodam-ead

title: Default DEM from the floodam-ead package — floodam_ead_dem
code: data("floodam_ead_dem", package = "rsic2") floodam_ead_dem #> [1] "This is a PackedSpatRaster object. Use 'terra::rast()' to unpack it" terra::rast(floodam_ead_dem) #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 400, 205, 1  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 25, 25  (x, y) #> extent      : 1e+05, 105125, 1e+05, 110000  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : WGS 84 / UTM zone 19S (EPSG:32719)  #> source      : memory  #> name        :    lyr.1  #> min value   :     8.05  #> max value   : 46.64037

what: Get a selection of variables from a simulation result — get_result
title: Get a selection of variables from a simulation result — get_result
text: Get selection variables simulation result

title: Get a selection of variables from a simulation result — get_result
code: get_result(   cfg,   scenario,   variant = 0,   filters = c(""),   fun_format = NULL,   m = read_bin_result_matrix(cfg, scenario, variant) )

title: Get a selection of variables from a simulation result — get_result
text: cfg config object. Configuration use. See loadConfig details scenario numeric, scenario use variant numeric, variant use (0 default means variant) filters character conditions select columns result table, see details fun_format function format result (See tidy_result) m matrix results produced read_bin_result_matrix

title: Get a selection of variables from a simulation result — get_result
text: format =NULL, matrix results first column "t" simulation time seconds followed columns selected filters. Column names concatenation nested SIC model elements separated character "|" numbered character ":". variable represented item "var". example, water elevation first section first reach : "bf:1|sn:1|var:Z". format = tidy_result format = compact_tidy_result, see documentation tidy_result.

title: Get a selection of variables from a simulation result — get_result
code: if (FALSE) { cfg <- cfg_tmp_project() sic_run_steady(cfg, scenario = 1) get_result(cfg, 1, filters = c("bf==4", "var=='Z'")) }

what: Get correspondence between network object and columns in result binary file — get_result_tree
title: Get correspondence between network object and columns in result binary file — get_result_tree
text: Get correspondence network object columns result binary file

title: Get correspondence between network object and columns in result binary file — get_result_tree
code: get_result_tree(cfg, scenario, variant = 0)

title: Get correspondence between network object and columns in result binary file — get_result_tree
text: cfg config object. Configuration use. See loadConfig details scenario numeric, scenario use variant numeric, variant use (0 default means variant)

title: Get correspondence between network object and columns in result binary file — get_result_tree
text: data.frame following columns: "bf", "sn", "nd", "pr", "ouv": location result number respectively reach, section, node, offtake, device. "var": name calculated variable "col": column number matrix produced read_bin_result_matrix

title: Get correspondence between network object and columns in result binary file — get_result_tree
text: now, function handle results sections.

title: Get correspondence between network object and columns in result binary file — get_result_tree
code: if (FALSE) { cfg <- cfg_tmp_project() sic_run_steady(cfg, scenario = 1) df <- get_result_tree(cfg, 1) head(df) }

what: Get coordinates of section centers — get_section_centers
title: Get coordinates of section centers — get_section_centers
text: coordinates segment, function returns coordinates equidistant points along segment given number points

title: Get coordinates of section centers — get_section_centers
code: get_section_centers(node_coords, nb_sections)

title: Get coordinates of section centers — get_section_centers
text: node_coords 2-rows matrix, coordinates segment boundaries nb_sections 1-length numeric, number points extract

title: Get coordinates of section centers — get_section_centers
text: matrix coordinates points along segment

title: Get coordinates of section centers — get_section_centers

what: Read default configuration of the package and complete it with eventual user config — loadConfig
title: Read default configuration of the package and complete it with eventual user config — loadConfig
text: Read default configuration package complete eventual user config

title: Read default configuration of the package and complete it with eventual user config — loadConfig
code: loadConfig(   sic_path = NULL,   xml_path = NULL,   userFile = "config.yml",   pathDefaultCfg = system.file("config.yml", package = "rsic2") )

title: Read default configuration of the package and complete it with eventual user config — loadConfig
text: sic_path character, path installation SIC (see details) xml_path character, path XML project file (see details) userFile location user config YML file pathDefaultCfg location default configuration (located "inst/config.yml" package default)

title: Read default configuration of the package and complete it with eventual user config — loadConfig
text: configuration returned config::get. Configuration RSIC2 following structure: sic path: Path local SIC installation (defined sic_path parameter user config file) edisic: sub-path EdiSIC program talweg: sub-path TALWEG program fluvia: sub-path FLUVIA program sirene: sub-path SIRENE program export: sub-path SicExport program fortran: prms: INTERF: default INTERF parameter injected command line arguments TALWEG, FLUVIA, SIRENE project path: Path XML project file (defined xml_path parameter user config file) stricklers: vector 2 numeric values representing respectively default minor medium bed Strickler coefficients apply sic_import_reaches

title: Read default configuration of the package and complete it with eventual user config — loadConfig
text: path SIC XML project file can defined user XML file defining appropriate items:  Moreover, sic_path can defined environment variable "SICPATH". setting default overwritten path defined user YAML file, also overwritten one define sic_path argument.
code: sic:    path: Path/To/SIC/installation  project:    path: Path/To/Xml/Project/File.xml

title: Read default configuration of the package and complete it with eventual user config — loadConfig
code: library(rsic2) sic_path <- tempdir(check = TRUE) xml_path <- R.utils::tmpfile() cfg <- loadConfig(sic_path, xml_path) str(cfg) #> List of 2 #>  $ sic    :List of 7 #>   ..$ fortran:List of 1 #>   .. ..$ prms:List of 1 #>   .. .. ..$ INTERF: chr "0" #>   ..$ path   : chr "C:\\Users\\DAVID~1.DOR\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Rtmp80xC7T" #>   ..$ edisic : chr "exe/EdiSIC.exe" #>   ..$ talweg : chr "exe/TALWEG.exe" #>   ..$ fluvia : chr "exe/FLUVIA.exe" #>   ..$ sirene : chr "exe/SIRENE.exe" #>   ..$ export : chr "exe/SicExport.exe" #>  $ project:List of 2 #>   ..$ path      : chr "C:\\Users\\DAVID~1.DOR\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Rtmp80xC7T\\file3ca062052d47" #>   .. ..- attr(*, "gc")=<environment: 0x000000003712aa38>  #>   ..$ stricklers: int [1:2] 40 40 #>  - attr(*, "config")= chr "default" #>  - attr(*, "file")= chr "C:\\Users\\david.dorchies\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpsD6aZ8\\temp_libpath257077564f2a\\rsic2\\config.yml"

what: Merge several ReachTxt objects into one — merge.ReachTxt
title: Merge several ReachTxt objects into one — merge.ReachTxt
text: Merge several ReachTxt objects one

title: Merge several ReachTxt objects into one — merge.ReachTxt
code: # S3 method for ReachTxt merge(x, y = NULL, ...)

title: Merge several ReachTxt objects into one — merge.ReachTxt
text: x First ReachTxt object merge y Second ReachTxt object merge ... ReachTxt objects merge

title: Merge several ReachTxt objects into one — merge.ReachTxt
text: ReachTxt object (See create_uniform_reach_txt dem_to_reach) containing merged reaches.

title: Merge several ReachTxt objects into one — merge.ReachTxt
code: # Minor bed generation profT <- list(   B = 2,   S = (6 - 2) / 2 / 2,   ZF = 100,   ZB = 100 + 2 ) min_reach <- create_uniform_reach_txt(abscissas = seq(0, 10000, 100),                          upstream_bed_elevation = 10 + 2000 * 0.002,                          slope = 0.002,                          section_type = "T",                          profile = profT)  # Major bed generation data("floodam_ead_dem") dem <- terra::rast(floodam_ead_dem) node_coords <- matrix(c(102550, 102550, 110000, 100000), ncol = 2) space_step = 100 section_width = 5000 maj_reach <- dem_to_reach_txt(dem, node_coords, space_step, section_width, major_bed = TRUE)  # Merge reaches into one reach <- merge(min_reach, maj_reach)

what: Merge SicInput objects into a list — merge.SicInput
title: Merge SicInput objects into a list — merge.SicInput
text: Merge SicInput objects list

title: Merge SicInput objects into a list — merge.SicInput
code: # S3 method for SicInput merge(x, y = NULL, ...)

title: Merge SicInput objects into a list — merge.SicInput
text: x SicInput object merge y SicInput object merge ... SicInput objects merge

title: Merge SicInput objects into a list — merge.SicInput
text: SicInputs object list SicInput

title: Merge SicInput objects into a list — merge.SicInput
text: list parameter compliant merge S3 method available R, method can either called typing merge merge.SicInput.

title: Merge SicInput objects into a list — merge.SicInput
code: # How to impose 5 m3/s in the upstream offtake of the model? # Define location of the boundary condition to set locations <- SicLocation(list(Nd = 1, Pr = 1, car = "Q")) # Define its value sicInputUpstream <- SicInput(5, locations = locations)  # Opening a gate at 0.5 m sicInputGate <- SicInput(   0.5,   locations = SicLocations(list(Bf = 3, Sn = 2, Ouv = 1, Car = "Ouverture")) )  # Merging all inputs sicInputs <- merge(sicInputUpstream, sicInputGate)

code: read_bin_result_matrix(cfg, scenario, variant = 0)

title: Read matrix of SIC simulation result file — read_bin_result_matrix
text: cfg config object. Configuration use. See loadConfig details scenario numeric, scenario use variant numeric, variant use (0 default means variant)

title: Read matrix of SIC simulation result file — read_bin_result_matrix
text: matrix simulation results

title: Read matrix of SIC simulation result file — read_bin_result_matrix
code: if (FALSE) { cfg <- cfg_tmp_project() sic_run_steady(cfg, scenario = 1) m <- read_bin_result_matrix(cfg, 1) str(m) }

what: Set stage-discharge curve at an offtake of the model — set_boundary_ZQ
title: Set stage-discharge curve at an offtake of the model — set_boundary_ZQ
text: Update existing stage-discharge boundary condition.

title: Set stage-discharge curve at an offtake of the model — set_boundary_ZQ
code: set_boundary_ZQ(cfg, scenario, nd, pr = 1, mZQ)

title: Set stage-discharge curve at an offtake of the model — set_boundary_ZQ
text: cfg config object. Configuration use. See loadConfig details scenario numeric, scenario use nd numeric, node number SIC model pr numeric, offtake number node mZQ matrix, stage-discharge relation first column water elevation meters second column discharge cubic meters per seconds

title: Set stage-discharge curve at an offtake of the model — set_boundary_ZQ
text: function used side effect XML file SIC project.

title: Set stage-discharge curve at an offtake of the model — set_boundary_ZQ
code: if (FALSE) { cfg <- cfg_tmp_project() z <- seq(5, 20, 1) Q <- (z-5)^1.5 set_boundary_ZQ(cfg, scenario = 1, nd = 3, mZQ = matrix(c(z, Q), ncol = 2)) }

title: Import initial conditions — set_initial_conditions
text: Import initial conditions scenario/variant result calculation new scenario/variant.

title: Import initial conditions — set_initial_conditions
code: set_initial_conditions(iniParams, cfg = loadConfig())

title: Import initial conditions — set_initial_conditions
text: iniParams numeric, arguments passed Edisic importing initial conditions. See details cfg config object. Configuration use. See loadConfig details

title: Import initial conditions — set_initial_conditions
text: Error code returned shell.

title: Import initial conditions — set_initial_conditions
text: iniParams numeric vector length 5. number correspond : number scenario import initial conditions number variant import initial conditions (Use "0" variant) Time seconds initial conditions import (Use "0" single permanent simulation time steps) number scenario initial conditions exported number variant initial conditions exported  (Use "0" variant)

title: Import initial conditions — set_initial_conditions
code: if (FALSE) { # Set up the configuration model cfg <- cfg_tmp_project()  # Generate the mesh of the model sic_run_mesh(cfg)  # Run steady simulation for the scenario #1 sic_run_steady(cfg, scenario = 1)  # Import initial condition from scenario 1 # to scenario 1, variant 1 for unsteady flow simulation set_initial_conditions(c(1, 0, 0, 1, 1), cfg = cfg)  # Run unsteady flow simulation sic_run_unsteady(cfg, scenario = 1, variant = 1)  # Or initiate and run the same unsteady flow simulation in one call sic_run_unsteady(cfg, iniParams = c(1, 0, 0, 1, 1)) }

what: Create a SIC input for a PAR file — SicInput
title: Create a SIC input for a PAR file — SicInput
text: Create SIC input PAR file

title: Create a SIC input for a PAR file — SicInput
code: SicInput(x, ...)  # S3 method for numeric SicInput(x, values = NULL, locations, interpolated = TRUE, ...)  # S3 method for POSIXt SicInput(x, values, start = NULL, ...)  # S3 method for data.frame SicInput(x, ...)  # S3 method for matrix SicInput(x, ...)

title: Create a SIC input for a PAR file — SicInput
text: x either fixed input, numeric vector time seconds, POSIXt vector time, matrix data.frame 2 columns (time value) ... used S3 method compatibility values numeric vector used x vector numeric POSIXt locations input locations created SicLocation SicLocations interpolated Interpolation mode TRUE "ramp" mode FALSE "step" mode start POSIXt indicating start time use time zero simulation

title: Create a SIC input for a PAR file — SicInput
text: SicInput object list following items: locations: SicLocations object data: numeric, fixed value, data.frame, time series apply locations interpolated: logical, interpolation mode

title: Create a SIC input for a PAR file — SicInput
code: # How to impose 5 m3/s in the upstream offtake of the model? # Define location of the boundary condition to set locations <- SicLocations(list(Nd = 1, Pr = 1, car = "Q")) # Define its value sicInputs <- SicInput(5, locations = locations)  # How to impose an hydrograph at the upstream offtake of the model? sicInputs <- SicInput(data.frame(t = c(0, 3600, 7200), # time in seconds                                 v = c(5, 20, 5)),     # flows                       locations = locations)

code: SicLocation(location)

title: Set a location of a SIC model input — SicLocation
text: location list containing location keys (see details)

title: Set a location of a SIC model input — SicLocation
text: SicLocation object character string format locations described sic documentation PAR files: https://sic.g-eau.fr/Format---par-file.

title: Set a location of a SIC model input — SicLocation
code: # How to impose 5 m3/s in the upstream offtake of the model? # Define location of the boundary condition to set locations <- SicLocations(list(Nd = 1, Pr = 1, car = "Q")) # Define its value sicInputs <- SicInput(5, locations = locations)  # How to impose an hydrograph at the upstream offtake of the model? sicInputs <- SicInput(data.frame(t = c(0, 3600, 7200), # time in seconds                                 v = c(5, 20, 5)),     # flows                       locations = locations)

what: Set locations of a SIC model input — SicLocations
title: Set locations of a SIC model input — SicLocations
text: SicLocation eventually several locations

title: Set locations of a SIC model input — SicLocations
code: SicLocations(...)

title: Set locations of a SIC model input — SicLocations
text: ... One several list describing location (See SicLocation)

title: Set locations of a SIC model input — SicLocations
text: SicLocations object list SicLocation.

title: Set locations of a SIC model input — SicLocations
code: # Applying the same flow to offtakes located in nodes number 1 to 10 locations <- lapply(seq(10), function(i) { list(Nd = i, Pr = 1, Car = "Q")}) locations <- do.call(SicLocations, locations) sicInputOfftakes <- SicInput(-0.5, locations = locations)

what: Import reach geometries into a SIC project — sic_import_reaches
title: Import reach geometries into a SIC project — sic_import_reaches
text: Import reach geometries SIC project

title: Import reach geometries into a SIC project — sic_import_reaches
code: sic_import_reaches(   reaches,   import_mode = "ImportXml_UPDATE",   cfg = loadConfig() )

title: Import reach geometries into a SIC project — sic_import_reaches
text: reaches list ReachTxt objects (See split_reach) import_mode character, importation mode EdiSIC (See https://sic.g-eau.fr/Import-sections--text-format?lang=en#import-modes-2) cfg config object. Configuration use. See loadConfig details

title: Import reach geometries into a SIC project — sic_import_reaches
text: numeric code returned shell

title: Import reach geometries into a SIC project — sic_import_reaches
code: # Minor bed generation profT <- matrix(c(2, 6, 0, 2), ncol = 2) min_reach <- create_uniform_reach_txt(abscissas = seq(0, 10000, 100),                                       upstream_bed_elevation = 8 + 10000 * 0.002,                                       slope = 0.002,                                       section_type = "L",                                       profile = profT)  # Major bed generation data("floodam_ead_dem") dem <- terra::rast(floodam_ead_dem) node_coords <- matrix(c(102550, 102550, 110000, 100000), ncol = 2) space_step = 100 section_width = 5000 maj_reach <- dem_to_reach_txt(dem, node_coords, space_step, section_width, major_bed = TRUE)  # Merge minor and major beds and split into 2 reaches reach <- merge(min_reach, maj_reach) reaches <- split_reach(reach, seq(0, 10000, 5000))  if (FALSE) { # Import with EdiSic cfg <- cfg_tmp_project() sic_import_reaches(reaches, cfg = cfg) }

code: sic_run_export(scenario, variant = 0, params, cfg = loadConfig())

title: Run SicExport and read the exported file — sic_run_export
text: scenario numeric, scenario use variant numeric, variant use (0 default means variant) params list location parameters result, see details. cfg config object. Configuration use. See loadConfig details

title: Run SicExport and read the exported file — sic_run_export
text: matrix read result

title: Run SicExport and read the exported file — sic_run_export
text: params parameter list representing parameters available https://sic.g-eau.fr/sicexport-utilitaire-d-exportation set model network location exported results. string parameter /x=n /yy=ii command line represented list(xxx = nnn, yy = ii).

title: Run SicExport and read the exported file — sic_run_export
code: if (FALSE) { params <- list(SCE=1) sic_run_steady(cfg, scenario = 1) # For exporting result in sections at time 0 sic_run_export(scenario = 1, params = list(t = 0)) }

what: Run Talweg, Fluvia or Sirene for a configured project — sic_run_mesh
title: Run Talweg, Fluvia or Sirene for a configured project — sic_run_mesh
text: Use sic_run_mesh run mesh generator, sic_run_steady steady flow simulation, sic_run_unsteady unsteady flow simulation.

title: Run Talweg, Fluvia or Sirene for a configured project — sic_run_mesh
code: sic_run_mesh(cfg, params = list())  sic_run_steady(cfg, scenario, variant = 0, sicInputs = NULL, params = list())  sic_run_unsteady(   cfg,   scenario = iniParams[4],   variant = iniParams[5],   sicInputs = NULL,   iniParams = NULL,   params = list() )

title: Run Talweg, Fluvia or Sirene for a configured project — sic_run_mesh
text: cfg config object. Configuration use. See loadConfig details params list character, see details scenario numeric, scenario use variant numeric, variant use (0 default means variant) sicInputs SicInput object list SicInput objects create merge.SicInput used create PAR file injectig inputs simulation iniParams 5-length numeric vector, see set_initial_conditions details

title: Run Talweg, Fluvia or Sirene for a configured project — sic_run_mesh
text: Error code returned shell.

title: Run Talweg, Fluvia or Sirene for a configured project — sic_run_mesh
text: argument params handles parameters describe SIC documentation. argument params list, arguments injected command line taking items list conversion [key]=[value]. default, parameter INTERF=0 added command line. argument params character string directly used parameters command line.

title: Run Talweg, Fluvia or Sirene for a configured project — sic_run_mesh
code: if (FALSE) { # Set up the configuration model cfg <- cfg_tmp_project()  # Generate the mesh of the model sic_run_mesh(cfg)  # Run steady simulation for the scenario #1 sic_run_steady(cfg, scenario = 1)  # Import initial condition from scenario 1 # to scenario 1, variant 1 for unsteady flow simulation set_initial_conditions(c(1, 0, 0, 1, 1), cfg = cfg)  # Run unsteady flow simulation sic_run_unsteady(cfg, scenario = 1, variant = 1)  # Or initiate and run the same unsteady flow simulation in one call sic_run_unsteady(cfg, iniParams = c(1, 0, 0, 1, 1)) }

title: Write a PAR file for SIC simulation — sic_write_par
text: Write inputs  PAR file respectively https://sic.g-eau.fr/Format---par-file.

title: Write a PAR file for SIC simulation — sic_write_par
code: sic_write_par(cfg, scenario, sicInputs)

title: Write a PAR file for SIC simulation — sic_write_par
text: cfg config object. Configuration use. See loadConfig details scenario numeric, scenario use sicInputs SicInput object list SicInput objects create merge.SicInput used create PAR file injectig inputs simulation

title: Write a PAR file for SIC simulation — sic_write_par
text: Nothing.

title: Write a PAR file for SIC simulation — sic_write_par
code: if (FALSE) { # Setting the model configuration cfg <- cfg_tmp_project()  # How to impose an hydrograph at the upstream offtake of the model? # Define the location of the upstream boundary condition to set locations <- SicLocations(list(Nd = 1, Pr = 1, car = "Q")) # Define its time series sicInputs <- SicInput(data.frame(t = c(0, 3600, 7200), # time in seconds                                 v = c(5, 20, 5)),     # flows                       locations = locations) # Write the parameters in the PAR file sic_write_par(cfg, 1, sicInputs) }

what: Split a reach into a list of reaches — split_reach
title: Split a reach into a list of reaches — split_reach
text: Split reach list reaches

title: Split a reach into a list of reaches — split_reach
code: split_reach(reach, x_limits)

title: Split a reach into a list of reaches — split_reach
text: reach ReachTxt object x_limits Chainage (.e. abscissas along reach) splitting points

title: Split a reach into a list of reaches — split_reach
text: list ReachTxt objects

title: Split a reach into a list of reaches — split_reach
code: # Create a 10km long trapezoidal uniform reach profT <- list(   B = 2,   S = (6 - 2) / 2 / 2,   ZF = 100,   ZB = 100 + 2 ) min_reach <- create_uniform_reach_txt(abscissas = seq(0, 10000, 100),                                       upstream_bed_elevation = 10 + 2000 * 0.002,                                       slope = 0.002,                                       section_type = "T",                                       profile = profT) # Split into reaches of 2000 m reaches <- split_reach(min_reach, seq(0, 10000, 2000))

title: Tidy a result simulation — tidy_result
text: Tidy result simulation

title: Tidy a result simulation — tidy_result
code: tidy_result(res)  compact_tidy_result(res)

title: Tidy a result simulation — tidy_result
text: res SicResult matrix provided get_result

title: Tidy a result simulation — tidy_result
text: tidy_result returns data.frame one line variable saved simulation result time step : one column per object type result (example: "bf" "sn" section "nd" "pr" offtake) one column "var" definition result variable one column "t" simulation time result variable one columne "value" value result variable compact_tidy_result returns data.frame one line variable : one column per object type result (example: "bf" "sn" section "nd" "pr" offtake) one column "var" definition result variable one column "values" containing data.frame  column value data.frame contains attribute "t" time saved simulation time steps seconds.

what: Update abscissas of Strickler portions in a SIC model — update_portion_abscissas
title: Update abscissas of Strickler portions in a SIC model — update_portion_abscissas
text: sic_import_reaches redefines abscissas reaches, Stricklers defined abscissas, geometry importation can lead inconsistent model. aim function reset Strickler definitions whole model default value one Strickler portion reach correct abscissas.

title: Update abscissas of Strickler portions in a SIC model — update_portion_abscissas
code: update_portion_abscissas(cfg, stricklers = cfg$project$stricklers)

title: Update abscissas of Strickler portions in a SIC model — update_portion_abscissas
text: cfg config object. Configuration use. See loadConfig details stricklers 2-length numeric, Strickler coefficient apply minor bed medium bed respectively

title: Update abscissas of Strickler portions in a SIC model — update_portion_abscissas
text: Use side effect XML project file.

title: Update abscissas of Strickler portions in a SIC model — update_portion_abscissas
code: if (FALSE) { cfg <- cfg_tmp_project() update_portion_abscissas(cfg, KMin = 50)  # Display first Strickler definitions encountered in the XML file x <- read_xml(cfg$project$path) xml_find_first(x, "//Stricklers") }
